runs.comm: and he's away first ball, shuffling across the stumps and turning a short ball nicely into the gap near the square leg umpire, running hard for a couple
beaten! Fast and full and the movement beats Amla as he pushes on the forward shuffle, feet not to the pitch, a loose shot indeed
much straighter delivery, 149ks, and Amla pats it back
150ks, short and rising and Amla hops up to try and plays the ball down, he does so with an angled bat and the ball rolls to the off side, thats three dots in a row

full and wide and he drives hard on the up to cover, where Warner dives forward to try and take the catch but the ball just falls short, he did well to take pace off the shot, but thats two more to Amla anyway
slides down leg stump and brushes the pads en route to Ronchi
starts off with a wide, full and swinging down leg stump
thats a great length, pitching just outside off stump and then straightening, and Gibbs leaves it be like this is day one of a Test match at the Wanderers
pitches fuller and he drives it on the rise to the man at cover
dragged in fractionally short and Gibbs tries to pull from outside off stump, but only succeeds in dragging it down in front of midwicket, hit off the toe end of the bat
turns a straighter delivery to midwicket and pinches a single
pitches on middle and off, straightens, and Amla clips to midwicket
pitches on a length and draws a thick edge to a diving Hussey at backward point
gets a wee bit of room and punches it off the back foot, the ball goes to the left of David Hussey again, who dives and stops the ball, the batsmen are confused and don't run
there's half a dozen, and the first six of the innings! Short and wide, very quick and steeping, and all Amla has to do is throw the bat and gets six over third man
good shot, Amla gets on top of a short ball and punches through the covers
151ks, pitches on leg stump and slides down, Gibbs hops and tries to nudge it off the pads but cannot make good contact
no footwork as he drives loosely, gets an inside edge on the pad, the ball trickles into the off side and Amla is quick to urge him on for the single, well run there

149.5ks says the speedometer, but methinks its a bit quicker than that! A nasty short ball dug in to get Amla hopping to take evasive action, he does very well to get his head out the way of that ripper and the ball beats Ronchi as well
pitches down leg with some good late swing, Gibbs clips to midwicket
slower ball, Gibbs inches forward and then adjusts to dab towards gully
good ball, hitting a good length and nipping back in off the seam, Amla pushes the ball to extra cover and sets off, the direct throw comes in but Ama is safe
gets across to swing a straight delivery over square leg, makes a bit of contact on the inside edge and Hopes does very well with a dive at short fine leg to save four
lovely angle beats him as he opens the face to steer it, doesn't carry to Ronchi
tickles a shorter ball down towards fine leg for one
pitches it outside off stump and thats slashed down to third man
makes room, dances down, and carves it on the up just over cover, David Hussey gives chase and cuts it down to three near the ropes
great shot, on the pads and delectably flicked away through square leg
quicker ball, short of a length, sits up and beats the back-foot shot
bouncer, 142.6ks, and Amla ducks under it with ease
holds back the length to press Amla on the back foot, he makes room and steers the ball down towards the left of backward point and gets a single to keep strike
overpitched and Amla flashes the drive to cover, where Warner stops well
now a leading edge! The ball pitches straight on a good length and Amla shuffles back to flick the ball toward midwicket, except he ends up playing it just safe between three fielders on the off side
comes forward and drives but straight to the man
and Hopes gets Gibbs! He kneels across and goes for that booming swipe only to send the ball down to Michael Hussey, running in from deep midwicket, who takes it on his knees
hops up and dabs a short of a length ball wide of backward point
comes forward and streakily steers the ball towards backward point
lovely flick, all wrists, clipping from middle stump out to deep square leg
142.3ks, bouncer over the stumps, and Duminy ducks low
defends the ball with soft hands, it trickles towards the off side, Duminy is hesitant but Amla is adamant they can get a single off that and he succeeds too, well run
overpitched outside off stump and Amla drives into the covers for one
pitches full on around off stump and he works it uppishly to midwicket
pulled straight to White at short midwicket! The short ball works for Hilfenhaus, Amla tries to collect from outside off stump but plays it high off the bat to the fielder
flighted up outside leg stump, Duminy flicks into the midwicket region
and it works! Hussey floats that up full on the stumps, van Jaarsveld doesn't get far enough across as he goes for the sweep, and cops it flush on the pad in front of middle and leg
fired in flat on the stumps and Boucher digs it back out to Hussey
now he gets a single, working it from off stump toward midwicket

safest place to score your runs! Hussey jumps up in agony as the ball sits up and  draws and edge that Ronchi can't hold onto and the ball flies down to the ropes, it didn't even hit the gloves, so can't say its a drop
comes forward and drives the ball to mid-on for one
slides down the stumps and he plays it away toward square leg
uses his feet and drives the ball towards midwicket for one
cute shot, opens the face and dabs it fine to raise South Africa's 50
shuffles across the stumps and flicks the ball wide of square leg
pitches on a length and Duminy drives on the rise into the covers for one
tossed up on a length, Boucher comes forward and steers it to point
gets some room, waits, and forces the ball behind backward point
comes forward and pushes the ball towards extra cover
short ball and he flashes an thick edge safely wide of short third man
comes forward and uses the wrists, clipping wide of midwicket
fired in flat, he comes across and turns the ball to midwikcet
tossed up and he comes out to push the ball into the covers
pitched up outside off stump, Duminy drives down to long-off

how did that miss! David Hussey intercepts a firm cut shot from Boucher to his right at point, takes no time to release the ball but he misses the nonstrikers stumps with Boucher not even in the frame
pitches a bit wider and he steers it down to third man for one
uses his feet to collect on the full, driving down to Bracken at long-off
another nervous single dabbed through the off side, Tait runs in and fields
fails to cash in on a full toss, instead chipping in the air past midwicket
tossed up gently on off stump and Boucher pushes it back to Hussey
flicks across the line, and a good stop keeps them to a single
a touch shorter and Duminy pulls out to deep midwicket for one more
pulls across the line, not timed well, and another single past midwicket
tossed up and Duminy drives to mid-off, who is a bit deep
tossed up a bit wider and Boucher come out to drives past cover
ah, fielded! Boucher cuts again to backward point, David Hussey flings himself to his left and stops the ball, then fires a throw that again misses the stumps
welcome boundary! Tait bowls full down leg stump and Duminy uses the pace to flick down to fine leg, the first four for 27 deliveries, mind you
poor stuff, full and down the pads again, this time its called wide
angling away and Duminy opens the face to steer a single to third man
full on the stumps and he miscues the drive down to mid-on, scampering
another dabbed single wide of backward point for a single
slower delivery, 120ks, which Boucher clubs back over Tait's over
shot, Duminy! Hopes strays on the stumps and Duminy just helps it on its way over deep square leg for six with the most amazing pick up paddle shot, all wrists
more orthodox approach now, steering a single down to deep point
swipes across the line and sends a top edge to Tait at backward point
full on the stumps and played to deep mid-off for a single
stands his ground and steers the ball to Tait at deep point
drills a length ball straight back past mid-off, Warner runs across and dives superbly, flicking the ball to the other fielder, man he's some rock star in these parts, just listen to the cheer
comes forward and pushes the ball towards the off side
149.5sks, banged in short down leg stump, Morkel ducks low
short of a length on leg stump, Morkel hops back and pushes the ball to the off side, just a tip and run, and Duminy responds brilliantly too
nice meaty blow from Duminy, backing away to the sixth stump and clubbing the ball across the line, just picking it over the man at mid-on for a needed boundary
backs away and drills a full ball straight to deep mid-off, doesn't run
top shot! Duminy is striking them well, this time he backs away and connects superbly, driving hard and past extra cover before the fielder can respond
chases a very full and wide ball and falls down, wide not signalled?
fetch that! Morkel clubs the ball dead straight back past Hopes, who sways out of the way to save his block being knocked off, and neither long-off nor long-on get there
low full toss outside off stump, pushed into the covers for one
swings across the line and inside edges smack past square leg
fetches it from well outside off stump, doesn't connect well at all but the ball drops safely in front of David Hussey down at long-on
low full toss on leg stump, driven wide of mid-on this time
another very full ball outside off stump, which Morkel scoops towards Ponting in the covers, who attacks the ball but ends up fumbling the take, so they get two
slow bouncer, 113ks, and Paul Reifel calls it a wide
swings down the pads, inside-edged to short fine leg
reaches out and drives the ball into the covers
again he reaches out and thrashes the ball into the off side
sweet shot, Morkel! On the pads and swung over long-on for a flat six
clever slower ball to end the over, Morkel exposes the stumps and swings it away, instead getting an inside edge onto the boots and Duminy calls him for the single

swung down to long -on! Bracken strikes first ball, pitching it just outside off stump, Morkel connects well with the big swipe but David Hussey runs across and from long-off and takes the ball to his right, very well held, even as the other fielder converged from the other side
slower ball pitches full outside off stump, Duminy comes across and clips the ball wide of midwicket to raise a very well played half-century
pitches full just around off stump and McKenzie dabs it into the covers
Tait drops him at gully! Duminy backs away and carves the ball, the fielder dives forward to his left but spills the chance
yorker just outside off stump, dug out into the covers for one more
very full and wide, he reaches out and edges wide of Ronchi for four
full and wide, he goes for some sort of paddle and can't connect
pulls a short ball from outside off stump, picks it over midwicket, White dives well on the ropes and saves two runs, well stopped there
opts for another paddle shot but misses, the attempted yorker hits him on the full as he sweeps across the stumps, hit outside the line and Duminy calls him on
too far from off stump and another single to the total
overpitched outside off stump and he carves the ball wide of cover
gets up on the toes to uppercut a short ball but chops the ball to point
clever full and slower ball which Duminy cannot get bat on
slower ball, just 102ks, very full and squirted to cover for one
130ks, full and swinging down leg stump, Duminy moves back and swings the bat but only gets a thin inside edge onto his pads, then gets a single to the off
swings across a full ball and clips the ball to midwicket for one
there's a healthy shot! Bracken veers a bit too wide outside off stump and Duminy lofts him back over long-off's head for six, lovely strike and thats what South Africa need
on the stumps, slower ball, and superbly lapped with fine leg up
full toss outside off stump, heaved over mid-on for a couple more
